{{Infobox musical artist | name = Ana Pupedan | image = Ana Pupedan.jpg | caption = Ana Pupedan | landscape = yes | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Slovenia]] | genre = [[Jazz]], [[Punk rock|Punk]], [[Country music|Country]], [[Blues]], [[Ska]], [[Reggae]] | years_active = 1992 – now | website = [https://web.archive.org/web/20080914192328/http://www.anapupedan.com:80/ www.anapupedan.com] | current_members = [[Simon Avsec]], [[Boštjan Požar]], [[Marko Doles]], [[Peter Žnidaršič]] }} '''Ana Pupedan''' is a [[musical group]] from [[Pivka]], [[Slovenia]]. The band was founded in 1992 by [[Simon Avsec]] ([[Singing|vocal]], [[violin]]), [[Boštjan Požar]] ([[guitar]], [[clarinet]]), [[Peter Žnidaršič]] ([[bass guitar]]), and [[Marko Doles]] ([[Drum kit|drums]]).
In the local [[Slovene language|Slovene dialect]], "Ana Pupedan" means ''One in the afternoon'', but many mistakenly believe that the band's name stands for some [[girl]].
==Discography== *''Anje Pupedanju'' (1995 KŠOPP, reissue 1998, Vinilmanija) *''Ante prupagandni balar'' (1998, Vinilmanija) *''Brez naslova'' (2001, self distribution) *''Na domači brjači'' (2010, Založba Radia Študent (ZARŠ))
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20080914192328/http://www.anapupedan.com/ anapupedan.com] *[http://www.myspace.com/anapupedan Ana Pupedan MySpace] *[http://zalozba.radiostudent.si/bands.php?id=13 Ana Pupedan at Založba Radia Študent (ZARŠ)]
{{Authority control}}

revision.text:
{{Further|Demographics of Europe}} {{Unreferenced|date=August 2010}} This is a '''list of countries and territories in [[Europe]] by [[population density]]'''. ==Transcontinental countries== Some of the countries listed below are [[transcontinental country|transcontinental]], meaning that they are only partially located in Europe: * The list includes all of '''[[Russia]]''', as [[European Russia]] contains about 77% of the country's total population (110,000,000 people out of about 143,000,000) in an area comprising roughly 3,960,000 square kilometres (1,528,560 sq mi); an average of 27.5 people per km2 (71.2 /sq mi). *Only [[European France|European '''France''']] is included, not its [[overseas departments]]. *The data for '''[[Spain]]''' includes [[islands of Spain|islands]] and [[Plazas de soberanía|exclaves]] on or near the African continent. *The data for '''[[Portugal]]''' includes the [[Azores]] and [[Madeira Islands]]. *The data for '''[[Netherlands]]''' includes European Netherlands and the [[Caribbean Netherlands]]. It does not include the Caribbean islands [[Aruba]], [[Curaçao]] and [[Sint Maarten]] as they are constituent countries within the [[Kingdom of the Netherlands]]. The primarily [[Asia]]n nation of '''[[Kazakhstan]]''' is not included in the list below. [[Armenia]] and [[Cyprus]], entirely Asia [[Physical geography|physiographically]], have political and cultural ties to Europe. There is some discussion about whether [[Kosovo]] should be recognised as a separate country. ''[[De facto]]'' it can be considered as one, but ''[[de jure]]'' recognition [[International reaction to the 2008 declaration of independence by Kosovo|is not clear-cut]]. The aggregate for Europe excluding Russia, Azerbaijan and Georgia, the population density is 103 persons per km2. ==Countries and dependencies== [[File:European countries by population, 2018.png|thumb|European countries by population|350px]] [[File:European countries by population density per sq km.jpg|thumb|European countries by population density|350px]] {| class="wikitable sortable" |+ Population density, area and population of countries and dependencies in Europe |- valign="top" ! revision.text:
{{Infobox film | name = Ceddo | image = Ceddo 1977.jpg | caption = | director = [[Ousmane Sembène]] | producer = | writer = Ousmane Sembène | screenplay = | starring = Tabata Ndiaye
Moustapha Yade | music = [[Manu Dibango]] | cinematography = Georges Caristan | editing = Florence Eymon |studio=Film Doomi Reew| distributor =[[New Yorker Films]] {{small|(1978) ([[United States|USA]]) (subtitled)}} | released = {{film date|1977|7||[[Berlinale]]}} | runtime = 120 minutes | country = [[Senegal]] | language = [[French language|French]]
[[Wolof language|Wolof]] }} '''''Ceddo''''' ({{IPA-wo|ˈtʃɛd.do|pron}}), also known as ''The Outsiders'',[http://hcl.harvard.edu/hfa/films/2007fall/sembene.html "Ousmane Sembene – In Memoriam"], Harvard Film Archive. is a 1977 Senegalese drama film directed by [[Ousmane Sembène]].[http://www.nowplayingaustin.com/event/detail/441214341/Essential_Cinema_Ceddo "Essential Cinema: Ceddo".] It was entered into the [[10th Moscow International Film Festival]].{{cite web|url=http://www.moscowfilmfestival.ru/miff34/eng/archives/?year=1977 |title=10th Moscow International Film Festival (1977) |accessdate=2013-01-13 |work=MIFF |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130116194935/http://www.moscowfilmfestival.ru/miff34/eng/archives/?year=1977 |archivedate=2013-01-16 |df= }} == Plot == In [[Senegal]], sometime after the establishment of a European presence in the area but before the imposition of direct French colonial administration, the Ceddo ("commoners") try to preserve their traditional culture against the onslaught of [[Islam]], [[Christianity]], and the slave trade. When local king Demba War sides with the Muslims, the Ceddo abduct his daughter, Dior Yacine, to protest their forced conversion to [[Islam]]. After trying to rescue the princess, various heirs to the throne are killed, and Demba War is killed during the night. Eventually the kidnappers are killed and Dior Yacine is brought back to the village to confront the [[imam]], just as all the villagers are being given [[Muslim names]]. == Banning == Along with a number of Sembène's other films, ''Ceddo'' was banned in Senegal for its presentation of the conflicts between the Islamic and Christian religions and ethnic and traditional beliefs.{{cite web |url=http://www.ejumpcut.org/archive/onlinessays/JC36folder/Emitai-Ceddo.html|title=Emitai Ceddo |accessdate=2013-10-17}} According to another account reported in ''[[The New York Times]]'' in 1978, the banning was not "because of any religious sensitivity, but because Mr. Sembene insists on spelling 'ceddo' with two d's while the Senegalese Government insists it be spelled with one."Vincent Canby, [https://www.nytimes.com/movie/review?res=980CE3DF1530E632A25754C1A9649C946990D6CF "Film: 'Ceddo,' a Pageant From Sembene's Africa:Stately Power Struggle"], ''The New York Times'', 17 February 1978. ==See also== * [[Cinema of Senegal]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb title|id=0077309}} *{{rottentomatoes|ceddo}} {{Ousmane Sembène}} [[Category:Films directed by Ousmane Sembène]] [[Category:Senegalese films]] [[Category:1976 films]] [[Category:French-language films]] [[Category:Wolof-language films]] [[Category:Films set in the 17th century]] [[Category:Films set in Senegal]] [[Category:Films set in pre-colonial sub-Saharan Africa]] {{Senegal-film-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox ethnic group |group = Czechs in the United Kingdom |image = |caption = |population = '''Czech-born residents'''
45,000 (2013 ONS estimate) |popplace = [[Greater London]] and [[South East England]] |langs = [[British English]], [[Czech language|Czech]] |rels = [[Roman Catholicism]]{{·}}[[Religion in the United Kingdom|Others]]. |related = [[Czech people]]{{•}}[[White Other]] }} '''Czechs in the United Kingdom''' refers to the phenomenon of [[Czech people]] migrating to the [[United Kingdom]] from the [[Czech Republic]] or from the political entities that preceded it, such as [[Czechoslovakia]]. There are some people in the UK who were either born in the Czech lands or have Czech ancestry, some of whom descended from Jewish refugees (e.g. [[Kindertransport]]) who arrived during [[World War II]]. ==Population== The [[2001 UK Census]] recorded 12,220 Czech-born people resident in the UK.{{cite web|url=http://www.oecd.org/dataoecd/18/23/34792376.xls |title=Country-of-birth database |publisher=[[Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development]] |accessdate=7 November 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090617032129/http://www.oecd.org/dataoecd/18/23/34792376.xls |archivedate=17 June 2009 |df= }} With the accession of the Czech Republic to the [[European Union]] in May 2004, Czechs gained the right to live and work elsewhere in the EU, and large numbers moved to the UK for work, although there has been substantial return migration.{{cite web |url=http://www.ippr.org/members/download.asp?f=%2Fecomm%2Ffiles%2Ffloodgates%5For%5Fturnstiles%2Epdf |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090421131227/http://www.ippr.org/members/download.asp?f=%2Fecomm%2Ffiles%2Ffloodgates_or_turnstiles.pdf |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2009-04-21 |title=Floodgates or turnstiles? Post-EU enlargement migration to (and from) the UK |last=Pollard |first=Naomi |author2=Latorre, Maria |author3=Sriskandarajah, Dhananjayan |date=April 2008 |publisher=Institute for Public Policy Research |accessdate=2009-11-07 |df= }} The [[Office for National Statistics]] estimates that 45,000 Czech-born immigrants were resident in the UK in 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/rel/migration1/population-by-country-of-birth-and-nationality/revisions-to-population-by-country-of-birth-and-nationality---calendar-years-2004-to-2013/country-of-birth-and-nationality-tables--2013.xls|title=Table 1.3: Overseas-born population in the United Kingdom, excluding some residents in communal establishments, by sex, by country of birth, January 2013 to December 2013|publisher=[[Office for National Statistics]]|date=2 July 2015|accessdate=20 July 2015}} Figure given is the central estimate. See the source for 95 per cent [[confidence interval]]s. The [[United Kingdom Census 2011|2011 UK Census]] recorded 34,615 Czech-born residents in [[England]], 1,256 in [[Wales]],{{cite web|url=http://www.ons.gov.uk/ons/rel/census/2011-census/quick-statistics-for-england-and-wales-on-national-identity--passports-held-and-country-of-birth/rft-qs213ew.xls|title=Table QS213EW: 2011 Census: Country of birth (expanded), regions in England and Wales|publisher=Office for National Statistics|date=26 March 2013|accessdate=20 July 2015}} 2,245 in [[Scotland]],{{cite web|url=http://www.scotlandscensus.gov.uk/documents/censusresults/release2a/rel2a_COB_detailed_Scotland.pdf|title=Country of birth (detailed)|publisher=National Records of Scotland|accessdate=20 July 2015}} and 662 in [[Northern Ireland]].{{cite web|url=http://www.ninis2.nisra.gov.uk/Download/Census%202011_Excel/2011/QS206NI.xls |title=Country of Birth – Full Detail: QS206NI |publisher=Northern Ireland Statistics and Research Agency |accessdate=20 July 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304095516/http://www.ninis2.nisra.gov.uk/Download/Census%202011_Excel/2011/QS206NI.xls |archivedate=4 March 2016 |df= }} The figure for Scotland includes people who specified that they were born in Czechoslovakia, but the figures for England, Wales and Northern Ireland do not. 1,279 people in England, 39 in Wales and 16 in Northern Ireland are recorded as having been born in Czechoslovakia without specifying the Czech Republic or Slovakia. {{Czechs}} ==Notable people with Czech links== '''Bold''' indicates a non-citizen immigrant and normal text indicates a British citizen with Czech ancestry. * '''[[Milan Baroš]]''', footballer * '''[[Roman Bednář]]''', footballer * '''[[Patrik Berger]]''', footballer * [[Georgina Bouzova]], actress * '''[[Petr Čech]]''', footballer * [[Alf Dubs, Baron Dubs]], politician * '''[[Josef Franc]]''', motorcycle speedway rider * [[Eva Jiřičná]], architect * [[Jan Kaplický]], architect * [[Jan Kavan]], diplomat and politician * [[Čeněk Kottnauer]], chess master * [[Karel Kuttelwascher]], fighter pilot * [[Frank Lampl|Sir Frank William Lampl]], Life President of [[Bovis Lend Lease]] * [[Herbert Lom]], actor * [[Dan Luger]], English [[rugby union]] player * [[Jan Pinkava]], animator, film director * [[Karel Reisz]], film director * [[Tom Stoppard]], screenwriter, playwright * [[Miroslav Liskutin]], fighter pilot WW2 ==See also== * [[Demographics of the Czech Republic]] * [[Czech people]] * [[White Other]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.pohyby.co.uk www.pohyby.co.uk - Czech and Slovak community portal in the UK - more than 24000 members] * [http://www.czechandslovakclub.co.uk Czech and Slovak Club in London] * [http://www.bcsa.co.uk British Czech and Slovak Association] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20071011063602/http://czechcentres.cz/london/novinky.asp Czech Centre London] * [http://www.radio.cz/en/article/77682 Czech Radio London] {{Czech diaspora}} {{EuropeansinUK}} [[Category:Czech diaspora by country|United Kingdom]] [[Category:Czech diaspora in Europe|United Kingdom]] [[Category:British people of Czech descent| ]] [[Category:Immigration to the United Kingdom by country of origin]] [[Category:Czech Republic–United Kingdom relations]] {{UK-stub}} {{ethno-group-stub}}

revision.text:
{{Infobox non-profit | name = Egyptian Centre for Women's Rights (ECWR)
المركز المصري لحقوق المرأة | image = | type = [[Non-profit]] | founded_date = 1996 | founder = | location = [[Cairo]] {{flagicon|Egypt}} | coordinates = | origins = | key_people = [[Nihad Abu Al Qumsan]] (Chairperson) | area_served = [[Egypt]] | mission = | focus = | method = | num_employees = | subsid = | non-profit_slogan = ''Advancing women's legal and political rights since 1996'' | former name = | homepage = {{Official website|http://www.ecwronline.org}} | dissolved = | footnotes = }} The '''Egyptian Centre for Women's Rights''' ('''ECWR''') is a civil, independent, [[NGO|non-governmental]], [[non-partisan]], [[not-for-profit]] organization in [[Egypt]]. It supports Egyptian woman in obtaining full rights and [[Gender equality|equality]] with men. In addition, the ECWR motivates legislative authorities to review legislation related to women's rights, not only as it relates to the Egyptian Constitution, but international agreements as well. The ECWR consolidates both civil and political women's rights, and offers legal services to women who can not afford to pay for them.{{cite web|url=http://www.sis.gov.eg/En/Women/institutions/Local/NGOs/100401010000000001.htm |title=Non-governmental organizations concerned with women |date=2005 |publisher=sis.gov.eg |accessdate=2008-11-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081118170907/http://www.sis.gov.eg/En/Women/institutions/Local/NGOs/100401010000000001.htm |archivedate=2008-11-18 |df= }} Nihad Abu El-Qoumsan heads the organization.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/middle_east/7514567.stm|title=Egypt's sexual harassment 'cancer'|last=Abdelhadi |first=Magdi |date=18 July 2008|publisher=bbc.co.uk|accessdate=2008-11-21}} According to a survey issued by the ECWR in 2008, 83 percent of Egyptian women and 98 percent of foreign women within Egypt had experienced sexual harassment at some time. Of those who reported cases of sexual harassment to ECWR, only 12 percent had gone to the police with a complaint. Considering [[sexual harassment]] to be a social 'cancer', the ECWR asked the government to introduce legislation to curb it.{{cn|date=October 2016}} ==See also== * [[678 (film)|''678'' (film)]] * [[Feminism in Egypt]] * [[Gender inequality in Egypt]] * [[HARASSmap]] * [[Judiciary of Egypt]] * [[Mass sexual assault in Egypt]] * [[Operation Anti Sexual Harassment]] * [[Rape in Egypt]] * [[Women in Egypt]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.ecwronline.org/ Official website] {{Portal|feminism}} [[Category:Women's organisations based in Egypt]] [[Category:Women's rights in Egypt]] {{Egypt-stub}}

{{one source|date=September 2018}} {{italic title}} {{Infobox book | italic title = <!--(see above)--> | name = Enoc Huws | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | author = [[Daniel Owen]] | audio_read_by = | title_orig = | orig_lang_code = | title_working = | translator = | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = [[Wales]] | language = [[Welsh language]] | series = | release_number = | subject = | genre = | set_in = | publisher = | publisher2 = | pub_date = 1891 | english_pub_date = | published = | media_type = | pages = | awards = | isbn = | isbn_note = | oclc = | dewey = | congress = | preceded_by = | followed_by = | native_wikisource = | wikisource = | notes = | exclude_cover = | website = }} '''''Enoc Huws''''' is a classic novel by [[Daniel Owen]], written in the [[Welsh language]] and first published in 1891.<ref>Celtic culture: a historical encyclopedia. Vol. 1- - Volume 2 - Page 1411</ref> It has been adapted for stage and [[television]] (in an early 1974 TV adaptation, and later as ''Y Dreflan'' on [[S4C]]).
==Plot summary==
The story concerns the activities of the villainous Captain Trefor, and is set in the small town of Treflan, which appears in two earlier novels by the same author.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== *[https://archive.org/details/profedigaethauen00owenuoft ''Enoc Huws''] at the [[Internet Archive]] (in Welsh)
[[Category:Welsh-language novels]] [[Category:1891 British novels]] [[Category:Novels adapted into television programs]]

revision.text:
{{Onesource|date=November 2008}} The '''International Maritime Bureau''' is a specialized department of the [[International Chamber of Commerce]].
The IMB's responsibilities lie in fighting crimes related to [[Shipping|maritime]] trade and transportation, particularly [[Pirate|piracy]] and commercial [[fraud]], and in protecting the crews of ocean-going vessels. It publishes a weekly piracy report and maintains a 24-hour piracy reporting centre in [[Kuala Lumpur]], [[Malaysia]].
The IMB is part of ICC Commercial Crime Services whose other divisions include The Counterfeiting Intelligence Bureau, The Financial Investigation Bureau and FraudNet.
FraudNet is the world's leading network of fraud and asset recovery lawyers with 63 lawyers in 56 different jurisdictions.
The bureau, endorsed by the [[United Nations|UN]]'s [[International Maritime Organization|International Maritime Organisation]], was founded in 1981. The body has observer status with [[International Criminal Police Organization - Interpol|Interpol]] and a [[Memorandum of understanding|MOU]] with the [[World Customs Organization]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.icc-ccs.org/imb/overview.php|title=Overview|publisher=International Maritime Bureau|date=2008-05-26|accessdate=2008-05-26|language=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080530124118/http://www.icc-ccs.org/imb/overview.php|archivedate=2008-05-30|df=}}</ref>
Its present director is Captain [[Pottengal Mukundan]].
==Notes== <references/>
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20130310084811/http://www.icc-ccs.org/icc/imb International Maritime Bureau website] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20141008101644/http://www.icc-ccs.org/piracy-reporting-centre IMB Piracy Reporting Centre], including a live piracy update
{{Authority control}} [[Category:Maritime organizations]] {{int-org-stub}}

This is a list of the 50 '''largest cities in the Americas''' by population residing [[city proper|within city limits]] as of 2015, the most recent year for which official population census results, estimates or short-term projections are available for most of these cities. These figures do not reflect the population of the [[urban agglomeration]] or [[metropolitan area]] which typically do not coincide with the administrative boundaries of the city. For a list of the latter, see ''[[List of metropolitan areas in the Americas by population]]''. These figures refer to mid-2015 populations with the following exceptions: #Mexican cities, whose figures derive from the 2015 Intercensal Survey conducted by [[INEGI]] with a reference date of 15 March 2015;<ref name=MXdate>{{cite web |url=http://www.inegi.org.mx/est/contenidos/proyectos/encuestas/hogares/especiales/ei2015/doc/eic_2015_presentacion.pdf |title=Encuesta Intercensal 2015: Presentación de resultados |page=5 |publisher=[[INEGI]] |accessdate=2016-11-08}}</ref> #Calgary, whose 2015 municipal census had a reference date of April 1.<ref name=2015MAPL/>

page.title: List of World Heritage sites by year of inscription

revision.text:
This is a list of the [[United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization|UNESCO]] [[World Heritage site]]s around the world by year of inscription.{{Cite web|url=https://whc.unesco.org/en/list|title=UNESCO World Heritage Centre - World Heritage List|last=Centre|first=UNESCO World Heritage|website=whc.unesco.org|language=en|access-date=2018-07-03}}{{Cite web|url=http://whc.unesco.org/en/list/?&transboundary=1|title=UNESCO World Heritage Centre - World Heritage List (transboundary)|last=Centre|first=UNESCO World Heritage|date=|website=whc.unesco.org|language=en|access-date=2018-07-03}} The first World Heritage site in the list is [[Galápagos Islands]],{{cite web|url=http://whc.unesco.org/en/list/1|title=Galápagos Islands|first=UNESCO World Heritage|last=Centre|website=whc.unesco.org}} while the country with the largest number of sites (including sites shared with other countries) is [[Italy]], with 54 entries.{{Cite web|url=http://whc.unesco.org/en/statesparties/IT|title=Italy - UNESCO World Heritage Centre|last=Centre|first=UNESCO World Heritage|website=whc.unesco.org|language=en|access-date=2018-07-02}} The country with the largest number of sites by itself alone (excluding sites shared with other countries) is China, with 52 entries.{{Cite web|url=http://whc.unesco.org/en/statesparties/CN|title=China - UNESCO World Heritage Centre|last=Centre|first=UNESCO World Heritage|website=whc.unesco.org|language=en|access-date=2018-07-02}} '''(F)''' denotes the country's first inscription. ==2018 (42nd session)== '''19 sites''' (13 cultural, 3 natural, 3 mixed)

revision.text:
{{about|the 1953–1962 newspaper|the 2010–2018 newspaper|The New Age (South African newspaper)|other uses|New Age (disambiguation)}} '''''New Age''''' was an influential [[leftist]] newspaper in [[Johannesburg]] operating from 1953 to 1962. It was formed with the co-operation of a number of left-wing groups in the area; ''New Age'' received the assets of the [[communist]] Jewish Worker's Club, which had been liquidated in 1948.<ref>Adler, Taffy, "Lithuania's Diaspora: The Johannesburg Jewish Workers' Club, 1928-1948" (''Journal of Southern African Studies'', Vol. 6, No. 1, [1979], 70-92), 92.</ref> The newspaper later received support from a committee of the anti-[[apartheid]] [[South African Students' Association]].<ref>Gurney, Christabel, "'A Great Cause': The Origins of the Anti-Apartheid Movement, June 1959-March 1960" (''Journal of Southern African Studies'', Vol. 26, No. 1. [2000], pp. 123-144), 132.</ref>
From the start, ''New Age'' published fiction and poetry as well as journalism. The newspaper had a prize for fiction depicting the oppressions of apartheid,<ref>Lindfors, Bernth, "Post-War Literature in English by African Writers from South Africa: A Study of the Effects of Environment upon Literature" (''Phylon'', Vol. 27, No. 1. [1966], pp. 50-62), 53.</ref> and introduced several important politically aware poets, most notably [[Keorapetse Kgositsile]], who became the literary voice of the South African anti-apartheid movement while in exile in the [[United States]].
Its journalists, such as [[Joe Gqabi|Joe Nzingo Gqabi]]<ref>{{cite web| url= http://www.sahistory.org.za/people/joe-nzingo-gqabi| title= Joe Nzingo Gqabi| publisher= South African History Online | accessdate= 2012-10-05}}</ref> were aligned with the [[African National Congress]], particularly the older generation of the ANC leadership.<ref>Feit, Edward, "Generational Conflict and African Nationalism in South Africa: The African National Congress, 1949-1959" (''The International Journal of African Historical Studies'', Vol. 5, No. 2. [1972], 181-202), 195.</ref> It was sympathetic to labour movements and to militant leftists of all stripes. ''New Age'' was shut down by the government in 1962. The newspaper has now been brought back to life, in 2010, however the goals and style of the newspaper are different. It now mostly focuses on South African politics, and does not have any works of fiction or poetry. <ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.thenewage.co.za/jobs/|title=Jobs {{!}} The New Age|newspaper=The New Age|language=en-GB|access-date=2017-02-01}}</ref>
==References== <references/>
[[Category:Media in Johannesburg]] [[Category:Publications established in 1953]] [[Category:Publications disestablished in 1962]] [[Category:Defunct newspapers of South Africa]]
{{SouthAfrica-newspaper-stub}}

{{Globalize|date=January 2018}} '''Private healthcare''' or '''private medicine''' is [[healthcare]] and [[medicine]] provided by entities other than the government.
Ethical issues relating to private healthcare primarily concerns the argument that the seriously ill be entitled to spend money on saving their lives. On the other hand, private healthcare can sometimes be more efficient than public sector provision. Private operators may be more innovative in areas such as telemedicine. Due to the [[profit motive]], they can be more productive. The friendly behavior of staff and doctors are the main reason for people relying on private health care centers.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-national/tp-kerala/friendly-service-modern-facilities-draw-people-to-private-healthcare-centres/article18734394.ece|title=Friendly service, modern facilities draw people to private healthcare centres|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}</ref>
{{tone|date=January 2018}} ==Charging patients or private insurers for work== Europeans in all countries are willing to pay a charge for some private healthcare, whether to avoid long queues, to access cosmetic surgery, or to avoid the perceived risk of infection in public-sector hospitals. This is not a small market. In Finland, it is estimated that it is worth some €700m a year. In Greece, half the income of private hospitals is from one-off payments from patients. Maternity is a particularly large private market, as it is the demand for fertility both at home and abroad, where more than 18% of medical internet-based searches are related to infertility conditions and treatment.<ref>[http://www.allprivatehealth.com/[2]]</ref> Healthcare tourism is also thriving within the EU, in which patients (mainly from the UK) travel to Eastern Europe for low-cost dental work. The particularly wealthy Russians and Saudi Arabians tend to go to private hospitals in Switzerland or Germany.
As most Europeans have access to public sector provision either through their mandatory social insurance fund or through taxes, private healthcare insurance remains a relatively small market, with levels typically in the range of 2–8% of the population {{citation needed|reason=Source?|date=January 2016}}. Many consumers prefer to pay single fees as and when necessary. In addition, any occupational healthcare paid for by employers renders private healthcare insurance unnecessary. Nonetheless, around 10% of Germans have some form of private healthcare insurance which enables them to experience a slightly higher level of comfort during hospital stays{{citation needed|reason=Source?|date=January 2016}}. The most notable development in this area has been the Netherlands, which in 2005 moved to a system whereby all citizens are forced to take out private healthcare insurance rather than social insurance{{citation needed|reason=Source?|date=January 2016}}. This is being closely monitored by many European countries.
==Occupational healthcare== In many European countries with a state-run national health service, employers are obliged to pay for some level of healthcare for their employees. This is the case in Romania, Poland, and Finland, for instance, and one can find networks of small clinics in large cities in these countries. In other countries, such as the UK and Sweden, many employers are willing to pay for occupational healthcare for their workforce so that key workers can avoid delays in seeing a doctor when they are unwell. Naturally, though, the occupational health department of a publicly funded hospital will provide a similar standard of healthcare to that provided for patients.
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Types of healthcare facilities]] [[Category:Health economics]] [[Category:Health in Europe]]

{{unsourced|date=April 2012}} '''Radio Free Vietnam''' is the broadcasting network of a Vietnamese anti-communist group called the [[Government of Free Vietnam]] that is released throughout the world and its headquarters is located in Southern [[California]].
It is a non-profit organization that is able to broadcast directly into Vietnam and all of Asia. It calls for the right of freedom of opinion and expression - including the freedom to seek, receive and impart information and ideas through any medium regardless of frontiers.
==External links== *[http://www.rfvn.com/ Radio Free Vietnam] *[https://web.archive.org/web/20041212192831/http://gfvn.org/splash.html Government of Free Vietnam]

__NOTOC__ {{Infobox UK transmitter |name = Rugby |image = [[Image:Hillmorton radio masts.jpg|250px]] |caption = A view of the tallest masts |map_name = Warwickshire |coordinates = {{coord|52.36577|-1.18928|type:landmark_region:GB|display=inline,title}} |location = [[Hillmorton]], [[Rugby, Warwickshire|Rugby]], [[Warwickshire]] |height = {{convert|250|m|ft|0}} |gridref = SP5519574542 |built = 1926 |demolished = 2007 }} '''Rugby Radio Station''' was a large radio transmission facility at [[Hillmorton]] near the town of [[Rugby, Warwickshire|Rugby]], [[Warwickshire]] in England, situated just west of the [[A5 road (Great Britain)|A5 trunk road]] and in later years junction 18 of the [[M1 motorway]]. Part of the site was on the other side of the A5, across the border in [[Northamptonshire]]. First opened in 1926, at its height in the 1950s it was the largest radio transmitting station in the world, with a total of 57 radio transmitters, covering an area of 1600 acres. Traffic slowly dwindled from the 1980s onwards, and the site was closed between 2003 and 2007.<ref name="OWRRS">{{cite web|title=RUGBY RADIO STATION A short history|url=https://www.ourwarwickshire.org.uk/content/article/rugby-radio-station-2|publisher=Our Warwickshire|accessdate=24 October 2018}}</ref> ==History== Following the end of the [[First World War]] the British government set about implementing plans for an [[Imperial Wireless Chain]] to link the countries of the [[British Empire]]. It was decided that the new wireless service would be state-run by the [[General Post Office|Post Office]]. The site east of Hillmorton, was chosen in 1923. Part of the site had previously been occupied by [[RAF Lilbourne]] between 1915 and 1920.<ref name="OWRRS"/>
Its large [[very low frequency]] (VLF) transmitter came into service on 1 January 1926 and was originally used to transmit [[telegraph]] messages to the [[Commonwealth of Nations|Commonwealth]] as part of the [[Imperial Wireless Chain]]. After the 1950s this transmitter, active as callsign GBR on 16.0 kHz, using [[Morse code]] and later on 15.975 kHz with [[frequency-shift keying]] FSK and [[minimum-shift keying]] MSK, was used for transmitting messages to submerged [[submarine]]s. [[Criggion radio station]] acted as a reserve. The GBR transmitter was shut down on 1 April 2003 and was replaced by a new one at the [[Skelton transmitting station]].
In 1927, a second transmitter was installed to initiate the first transatlantic commercial telephone service; linking New York and London<ref>http://www.smecc.org/general_electric_computers/Houltonrepeater06123partial.jpg</ref> on 60 kHz using [[single-sideband modulation]]. This transmitter was decommissioned in 1956 and became the time signal transmitter [[MSF time signal|MSF]]. This new function developed from the decision, in 1951, to use the station to transmit modulated [[frequency standard|standard frequencies]] for scientific reference purposes. In 1972 these transmissions were consolidated onto the present frequency of 60 kHz and a further reference, that of a time signal, was added. In 1977 this took the form of the rolling ''slow code'' in use until April 2007, when BT's contract to transmit the time signal also passed to VT Communications, using their [[Anthorn radio station]] in Cumbria.
The aerial system at the VLF transmitter existed between 1926 and 2004 and consisted of twelve 250 metre (820 ft) high, guyed steel-framework masts insulated against ground and carrying an aerial wire. This wire was mainly destroyed by heavy iceloads in the winter of 1940. After the shutdown of GBR, the facility was only used for transmitting the MSF time signal. Therefore, eight of the twelve masts were obsolete and demolished on the night of 19 June 2004 to 20 June 2004.
The remaining four 'tall' masts were demolished on 2 August 2007. Most of the majority of the smaller masts still stand awaiting demolition before becoming an industrial estate <!-- <ref>[http://www.radiostationvision.com Radio Station Vision Website]</ref> -->
A trial transmission of the [[LORAN-C]] navigation system was run at the station from June 2005 until March 2007.<!-- <ref>[http://www.rin.org.uk/POOLED/articles/bf_newsart/view.asp?Q=bf_newsart_160022 Royal Institute of Navigation press release dated 18 May 2005]</ref> -->
[[File:Wire antenna insulator - Rugby Radio Station UK 1938.jpg|thumb|Strain insulator supporting the cage antenna, 1938]] [[Image:Demolished radio mast.jpg|thumb|right|250px|A radio mast after demolition]]
==See also== * [[List of masts]] * [[List of tallest buildings and structures in Great Britain]] * [[List of radio stations in the United Kingdom]]
==Notes== {{Reflist|1}}
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20061015113611/http://www.alan.melia.btinternet.co.uk/rugbyrs.htm A History of Rugby Radio] * [http://www.subbrit.org.uk/sb-sites/sites/r/rugby_radio/indexr67.shtml The Official History of Rugby Radio Station] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20071031013926/http://www.clockco.co.uk/documents/msf.pdf National Physical Laboratory – news of the MSF Move]

{{Use mdy dates|date=May 2018}} {{expand German|SEK-Trickfilmstudio|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox company | name = SEK Studio | native_name = 조선4·26만화영화촬영소 | romanized_name = Chosŏn 4.26 Atong Yŏnghwa Ch'al-yŏngso | foundation = {{start date|1957|09|07}}<ref name=tongil>{{cite news|url=http://www.tongilnews.com/news/articleView.html?idxno=14509|author=Yonhap News|script-title=ko:北`4.26아동영화촬영소` 아동영화 다수 창작|language=Korean|date=December 26, 2001|accessdate=June 23, 2013|publisher=Tongil News}}</ref> | location = [[Othan-dong]], [[Central District (Pyongyang)|Central District]] | location_city = [[Pyongyang]] | location_country = [[North Korea]] | key_people = Jun Ok Kim | industry = Animation | num_employees = 1,500 (2003)<ref name=forbes>{{cite journal|title=Axis of animation|author=Susan Kitchens|journal=Forbes|date=March 3, 2003|accessdate=June 23, 2013|url=http://members.forbes.com/global/2003/0303/014.html}}</ref> }} {{Infobox Korean name |context=north |hangul=조선4·26만화영화촬영소 |hanja= |rr= Joseon 4.26 Adong Yeonghwa Chwal-yeongso |mr= Chosŏn 4.26 Atong Yŏnghwa Ch'al-yŏngso }} '''Scientific Educational Korea''' or '''SEK Studio''' ({{Korean|조선4·26만화영화촬영소|context=north|lit="Korean April 26 Animation Film Studio"}}) is a North Korean animation studio, based in [[Othan-dong]], [[Central District (Pyongyang)|Central District]], [[Pyongyang]].<ref>{{Cite web | title = Korea SEK Company | website = Naenara | accessdate = 2016-05-16 | archive-date = 2005-02-13 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20050213003344/http://www.kcckp.net/en/trade/trade-company.php?9+984 | url = http://www.kcckp.net/en/trade/trade-company.php?9+984}}</ref>
==History== The studio started operations in September 1957, as April 26 Children's Film Studio.<ref name=tongil/> Around 1985, it began to outsource animation for European television.<ref name=pk-report>{{cite news|url=http://www1.korea-np.co.jp/pk/173rd_issue/2001122606.htm|title=Korean-made Cartoon Films Win Popular Acclaim among Animation Film Fan<nowiki>[</nowiki>s<nowiki>]</nowiki> in Europe|date=December 26, 2001|accessdate=June 24, 2013|work=PK Report from Pyongyang|publisher=The People's Korea|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20020223061949/http://www.korea-np.co.jp/pk/173rd_issue/2001122606.htm|archivedate=February 23, 2002|df=}}</ref> It was registered as the SEK Studio in 1997 in order to take part at an animation festival in France.<ref name=forbes/> SEK Studio participated in "Shijiazhuang International Animation Exhibition" on September 30, 2014.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.kotra.or.kr/user/globalBbs/kotranews/10/globalBbsDataView.do?setIdx=247&dataIdx=138670&pageViewType=&column=&search=&searchAreaCd=&searchNationCd=&searchTradeCd=&searchStartDate=&searchEndDate=&searchCategoryIdxs=&searchIndustryCateIdx=&searchItemCode=&searchItemName=&page=15&row=10|title=북한 애니메이션 산업 육성, 해외진출 확대 전망|language=ko|access-date=2018-04-23}}</ref> SEK Studio is expected to introduce a new science fiction genre animation.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.dihur.co.kr/1429|title=북한 "SF애니 과학기술 역군 육성위한 중대한 과업"|language=ko|access-date=2018-05-03}}</ref>
===History of Names=== * Chosun National Film Studio – Puppet Animation Film Research Institute (1957~1959) * Chosun National Film Studio – Animation Film Studio (1959~1960) * Chosun National Film Studio – Animation Film Production (1960~1964) * Chosun Children's Film Studio (1964~1971) * Chosun Science Education Film Studio – Animation Film Production Team (1971~1980) * Chosun Science Education Film Studio – Children's Film Production Team (1980~1996) * Chosun 4.26 Children's Film Studio (1996~2013) * Chosun 4.26 Animation Film Studio (2013~)
==Corporate size== As of 2003, SEK Studio employed over 1,500 people<ref name=forbes/> and subcontracted work for over 70 companies from around the globe, including Europe, [[South Korea]], China, Canada and the United States. After the introduction of advanced equipment, the number of employees was reduced to about 500.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.onbao.com/portal/sub_mobile_npc.php?type=N&sid=13729&gubun=onbao|title=북한의 비교우위 산업은?...애니메이션!|language=ko|access-date=2018-05-09}}</ref> There are 11 animation production teams in SEK Studio, 9 production teams are responsible for overseas animations subcontracting, and the 2 production teams produce domestic animations.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://unityinfo.co.kr/sub_read.html?uid=8103&section=sc21&section2=|title=북 대표적인 아동영화 제작소 ‘조선4.26아동영화촬영소’|language=ko|access-date=2018-05-23}}</ref> According to Animation Career Review, SEK is the 85th most influential animation studio of all-time. SEK Studio's staff is mostly from [[Pyongyang]] Art Academy, and SEK Studio has established an animation training institute to teach young students.<ref name="An Carreer 2012">{{cite web|last=Fronczak|first=Tom|title=Top 100 Most Influential Animation Studios of All-Time|url=http://www.animationcareerreview.com/articles/top-100-most-influential-animation-studios-all-time?page=0,1|accessdate=October 12, 2012}}</ref>
==Filmography== {{expand section|information on local productions from this company|date=June 2013}} SEK has provided animation for the following works:<ref name="Film 2012">{{cite web|title=SEK Animation Studio [kp]|url=https://www.imdb.com/company/co0157788/|publisher=IMDb|accessdate=October 12, 2012}}</ref>

===Animation services=== SEK Studio has subcontracted over 250 Foreign Animations. They mainly work on subcontracting Italian, French, Spanish and Chinese animation. American animation is outsourced in an indirect way.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.kotra.or.kr/user/globalBbs/kotranews/10/globalBbsDataView.do?setIdx=247&dataIdx=138670&pageViewType=&column=&search=&searchAreaCd=&searchNationCd=&searchTradeCd=&searchStartDate=&searchEndDate=&searchCategoryIdxs=&searchIndustryCateIdx=&searchItemCode=&searchItemName=&page=15&row=10|title=North Korean animation industry, Expansion into overseas markets|language=ko|access-date=2018-04-24}}</ref>
SEK has done work on several animated series from [[Mondo TV]], including ''[[Pocahontas (TV series)|''Pocahontas: Princess of the American Indians'']]''<ref>http://www.mondotv.it/scheda-singola-pocahontas.html</ref> and ''[[:it:Simba: è nato un re|Simba the King Lion]]'',<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.datum.at/0407/stories/3490038/|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100717015447/http://www.datum.at/0407/stories/3490038/|first=Solmaz|last=Khorsand|title=Knuddelachse|language=German|date=April 2007|accessdate=June 24, 2013|archivedate=July 17, 2010|work=[[Datum (magazine)|Datum]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=North Korea supplies laughs as well as lethal weapons|author=Park Chan-Kyong|url=http://www.nkeconwatch.com/2007/02/05/north-korea-supplies-laughs-as-well-as-lethal-weapons/|agency=AFP|newspaper=North Korean Economy Watch|date=February 5, 2007}}</ref><ref>http://www.mondotv.it/scheda-singola-simba-the-king-lion.html</ref> (due to this two, it has been repeatedly misinformed that SEK has worked for [[The Walt Disney Company]]). SEK also has produced features such as the French science fiction epic [[Gandahar (film)|''Gandahar'']] (''The Light Years'') and ''[[Empress Chung]]''.<ref name=nyt>{{cite news|title=Uniting the Two Koreas, in Animated Films at Least|first=Mark|last=Russell|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2005/08/31/movies/31chun.html|newspaper=The New York Times|date=August 31, 2005}}</ref>

{{Refimprove|date=October 2017}} [[File:Rathausturm Köln - Sigibert von Ripuarien (5907-09).jpg|thumb|upright|Statue of Sigobert the Lame on the tower of the city town hall of Cologne]]
'''Sigobert the Lame''' (also ''Sigibert'' or ''Sigebert'') (died c. 509) was a king of the [[Franks]] in the area of [[Zülpich]] ({{lang-la|Tolbiac}}) and [[Cologne]].
He was presumably wounded in the knee at the [[Battle of Tolbiac]] against the [[Alamanni]].<ref name=Howorth>[https://books.google.com/books?id=ye92FXOHQfUC&pg=PA235&lpg=PA235&dq=Sigobert+the+Lame&source=bl&ots=GkAVE9N_Sn&sig=VyyLPao1L3fo9Ri37hJJrBsIZcI&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwj2paC6z_bWAhVs6IMKHVdgB044HhDoAQhSMAc#v=onepage&q=Sigobert%20the%20Lame&f=false Howorth, H.H., "The Ethnology of Germany", ''The Journal of the Anthropological Institute of Great Britain and Ireland'', Volume 13, Anthropological Institute of Great Britain and Ireland, 1884, p. 235]</ref>
According to [[Gregory of Tours]], he was murdered by his son [[Chlodoric the Parricide|Chlodoric]] upon the instigation of [[Clovis I]], sometime after his victory over the Visigoths (507), when his son sent assassins upon him as he took a sojourn from his kingdom to a nearby forest. Chlodorich then told Clovis of the murder and offered him the finest treasures of his newly inherited kingdom as a symbol of their new alliance. Clovis sent messengers to assess the treasure, who then asked Chlodoric to plunge his hand as deeply into his gold coins as possible. With his arm submerged, the envoys of Clovis then killed the new king in betrayal. Clovis then stood before the people of Chlodoric and told them that the son had sent assassins to murder his father, but that Chlodoric had subsequently met his own end as well. Clovis then offered his protection to the former subjects of Sigobert and Chlodoric, and thus became their king.<ref name=Howorth/>
Gregory suggests that Chlodoric was murdered in the same campaign that killed the Frankish King [[Chararic (Frankish king)|Chararic]]. Before, Clovis had killed [[Ragnachar]] and his brothers.<ref name=Howorth/>
After all these murders, Gregory tells us that Clovis lamented that he had no family left, implying that among his own casualties were close relatives.
==References== {{Reflist}} *[[Gregory of Tours]]. ''The History of the Franks''. 2 vol. trans. [[Ormonde Maddock Dalton|O. M. Dalton]]. Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1967.

[[Big Daddy Kane]] | website = {{url|http://www.tonytouch.com/}} }} '''Joseph Anthony Hernandez''' (born July 2, 1969), professionally known as '''Tony Touch''', is an [[United States|American]] [[Hip hop music|hip hop]] [[break dancer]], [[singer-songwriter]], [[Record producer|producer]] and [[Disc Jockey|DJ]] of [[Puerto Rico|Puerto Rican]] descent. ==Career== Tony Touch began as a B-boy during the rap music renaissance era of the early 1980s.{{cite web|url=http://www.latinrapper.com/featurednews49.html |title=DJ Tony Touch Interview | Tony Toca Mixtapes |publisher=Latinrapper.com |date= |accessdate=2013-07-23}} Heavily influenced by pioneers like [[Crazy Legs (dancer)|Crazy Legs]] and the [[Rock Steady Crew]], [[Grandmaster Flash]], Red Alert, Little Louie Vega and Jam Master Jay, he quickly shifted his interests towards the turntables. Tony is known for his mixtapes the 50 Mcs parts 1, 2 and 3. His mixtapes have featured guest appearances from Eminem, [[KRS-One]], Kool G Rap, [[Big Daddy Kane]], [[Wyclef]], M.O.P, [[Big L]], and [[Mos Def]]. In 2000, Tony released his debut album ''[[The Piece Maker]]'' on Tommy Boy Records.{{cite web|author=Michael Gallucci |url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/the-piece-maker-mw0000058335 |title=The Piece Maker - Tony Touch | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date=2000-04-18 |accessdate=2013-07-23}} It sold 400,000 units worldwide and featured guest appearances from Big Pun, Cypress Hill, Wu-Tang Clan, [[Busta Rhymes]], [[Eminem]], and [[Gang Starr]]. In 2000 the single "I Wonder Why" featuring Total was released. The music video featured cameos from John Leguizamo, [[Rock Steady Crew]], Grand Master Flash, The Awesome 2, Marley Marl, and DJ Premier.{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/the-piece-maker/id405922773 |title=iTunes - Music - The Piece Maker by Tony Touch |publisher=Itunes.apple.com |date=2000-01-01 |accessdate=2013-07-23}} Since then, Tony Touch has released ''The Piece Maker 2'', which featured guest appearances from P. Diddy, Fat Joe, Sean Paul, Snoop Dogg, and Ruben Blades.{{cite web|author=David Jeffries |url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/the-piece-maker-vol-2-mw0000325103 |title=The Piece Maker, Vol. 2 - Tony Touch | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date=2004-02-24 |accessdate=2013-07-23}} Tony Touch is also known to represent the urban Latino community with his Spanglish lyrics and Salsa roots.{{cite web|author=Keith Nelson Jr (@JusAire) |url=http://allhiphop.com/2013/06/20/exclusive-dj-tony-touch-on-piece-makers-3-eminems-symphony-in-h-more-video/ |title=EXCLUSIVE: DJ Tony Touch on Piece Makers 3, Eminem’s "Symphony In H" + More (VIDEO) |publisher=AllHipHop.com |date=2013-06-20 |accessdate=2013-07-23}} This is the result of him growing up with salsa at home and hip-hop influence in his lifestyle. In 2005 Tony signed to EMI records releasing a reggaeton album, ''ReggaeTony''.{{cite web|author=David Jeffries |url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/the-reggaetony-album-mw0000251564 |title=The Reggaetony Album - Tony Touch | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date=2005-03-29 |accessdate=2013-07-23}} The lead single "[[Play That Song (Tony Touch song)|Play That Song]]" featured [[Nina Sky]] and [[B-Real]] of [[Cypress Hill]]. The CD included collaborations with artists such as Tego Calderon, Zion and Lenox, Pitbull, Ivy Queen, NORE, Voltio, Mexicano, Thirston Howl III, and Soni. The album went gold, and EMI moved quickly to release ''ReggaeTony 2''.{{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/album/reggaetony-2-mw0002128369 |title=Reggaetony 2 - Tony Touch | Songs, Reviews, Credits, Awards |publisher=AllMusic |date= |accessdate=2013-07-23}} This CD featured [[Lumidee]], Plan B, Joell Ortiz, Tru Life, Don Chezina, and the Beatnuts. To this date Tony has sold over a million records worldwide. On July 16, 2013, his sixth album ''[[The Piece Maker 3: Return of the 50 MC's]]'' was released and featured guest appearances from [[Busta Rhymes]], [[Reek da Villain]], [[Roc Marciano]], [[M.O.P.|Lil Fame]], [[Too Short]], [[Xzibit]], [[Kurupt]], [[B-Real]], [[Papoose (rapper)|Papoose]], [[Uncle Murda]], [[Black Thought]], [[Styles P]], [[Sheek Louch]], [[Jadakiss]], [[Raekwon]], [[Ghostface Killah]], [[RZA]], [[Eminem]], [[Twista]], [[Bun B]], [[Action Bronson]], [[Prodigy (rapper)|Prodigy]], [[Joell Ortiz]], [[Royce da 5'9"]], [[Krs-One]], [[Crooked I]], [[Redman (rapper)|Redman]], [[Method Man]], [[N.O.R.E.]], and [[Erick Sermon]].{{cite web|last=Paine |first=Jake |url=http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.23474/title.tony-touch-piece-maker-3-release-date-tracklist-album-stream |title=Tony Touch "Piece Maker 3" Release Date, Tracklist & Album Stream |publisher=HipHop DX |date=2013-07-08 |accessdate=2013-07-17}} In 2016 he paired up with [[Austin Brown]] to collaborate as CaliYork. They released the single "Show Up At My Place" in September.{{Cite news|url=http://youknowigotsoul.com/new-music-caliyork-austin-brown-dj-tony-touch-show-place|title=New Music: CaliYork (Austin Brown & DJ Tony Touch) - Show Up At My Place - YouKnowIGotSoul.com|date=2016-09-16|access-date=2017-09-29|language=en-US}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== * 2000: ''[[The Piece Maker]]'' * 2004: ''[[The Piece Maker 2]]'' * 2005: ''The Reggaetony Album * 2007: ''Reggaetony 2'' * 2013: ''[[The Piece Maker 3: Return of the 50 MC's]]'' ===EPs=== * 1998: ''The Rican-Struction'' ===Partial mixtape discography=== * 1991: ''Hip Hop Volume 1'' * 1996: ''Power Cypha: 50's MCs'' * 1997: ''Power Cypha 2'' * 1999: ''Power Cypha 3: The Grand Finale'' * 2002: ''B-Boy Breaks 3: James Brown Tribute'' * 2003: ''R&B Volume 30: The Love Session'' * 2010: ''Feel Good'' * 2011: ''Feel Good # 2'' ===Collaborations=== * 1997: ''[[5 Deadly Venoms of Brooklyn]]'' (w/ Evil Dee, Mister Cee, PF Cuttin and Premier) * 1997: ''The Diaz Brother'' (w/ Doo Wop) * 1998: ''Hip Hop 59 ft'' FunkMaster Flex * 1998: ''Terrorist Activity'' (w/ DJ Khaled) * 1999: ''The Diaz Brother: 2 for 5'' (w/ Doo Wop) * 2000: ''The Diaz Brothers: Live In Japan'' (w/ Doo Wop) * 2002: ''The Diaz Brothers 3'' (hosted by Kay Slay) * 2003: Mucho Muchacho - ''Chulería'' ===Singles=== {{expand section|more singles|date=January 2017}} * 2005: "[[Play That Song (Tony Touch song)|Play That Song]]" featuring [[Nina Sky]] and [[B-Real]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commonscat}} *[http://www.tonytouch.com/ Official website] *[http://www.discogs.com/artist/Tony+Touch Tony Touch] at [[Discogs]] *{{IMDb name|id=0869481|name=Tony Touch}} *[http://www.latinrapper.com/featurednews49.html Tony Touch interview] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Touch, Tony}} [[Category:1969 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American house musicians]] [[Category:American people of Puerto Rican descent]] [[Category:American record producers]] [[Category:American breakdancers]] [[Category:American hip hop DJs]] [[Category:Rappers from New York City]] [[Category:People from Manhattan]] [[Category:Sirius Satellite Radio]] [[Category:EMI Latin artists]]

revision.text:
{{multiple issues| {{advert|date=March 2017}} {{notability|Companies|date=March 2017}} {{more citations needed|date=March 2017}} {{Orphan|date=September 2018}} }}
{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2010}} {{Infobox company | name = Tring Digital | founder = Artan Dulaku | key_people = {{ubl|Artan Dulaku, President | Ridvana Dulaku, Administrator}} | products = {{ubl|Television production|Internet service provider|Fix telephony|Pay TV| Satellite|Cable| Terrestrial| IPTV|Advertising Communication|Distribution of analog signal, digital terrestrial and digital satellite}} | num_employees = 250 | homepage = www.tring.al | foundation = Tirana, Albania ({{Start date|2008|09|16}}) }} '''Tring''' is an [[Albania]]n company which operates in: *distribution of TV content through terrestrial, satellite<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lyngsat.com/packages/Tring-Digital.html|title=Tring Digital on Eutelsat 16A at 16.0°E - LyngSat|website=www.lyngsat.com|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://en.kingofsat.net/pack-tring.php|title=Packages: Tring Digital - KingOfSat|last=kingofsat|website=en.kingofsat.net|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref> and cable signal in Albania and [[IPTV]] worldwide (My Tring IPTV)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://mavise.obs.coe.int/company?id=9440|title=Company: ALBANIAN SATELLITE COMMUNICATIONS (TRING PACKAGE)|last=Observatory|first=European Audiovisual|website=mavise.obs.coe.int|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref> *broadband services of Internet, Telephony in Albania<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://ipinfo.io/AS47394|title=AS47394 Albanian Satellite Communications sh.p.k. - ipinfo.io|website=ipinfo.io|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ripe.net/membership/indices/data/al.tring.html|title=Members ordered by country code|website=RIPE Network Coordination Centre|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref>
Previously '''Tring''' was part of ''Albanian Satellite Communications'' (ASC or Tring Communications), which was founded in 2006 by Artan Dulaku. As the company’s operations grew,<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=biS8DAAAQBAJ&pg=PA164&lpg=PA164&dq=tring+digital#v=onepage&q=tring&f=false|title=Foreign Direct Investment Inflows Into the South East European Media Market: Towards a Hybrid Business Model|last=Vukanović|first=Zvezdan|date=2016-07-25|publisher=Springer|isbn=9783319305127|language=en}}</ref> ASC focused on satellite platform and spun off services on IP and Digital technology, giving birth to another company: Tring TV (Tring Digital).
On August 2014, these two companies decided to change their brands and logos, unifying under the unique brand TRING.
==Timeline== '''2008''' *Registered on 16 September 2008, Tring had its headquarters in Tirana, Albania. *Tring joins the market of pay television platforms<ref>{{cite web|url=https://books.google.al/books?id=vzFDAgAAQBAJ&pg=RA3-PA21&dq=tring+albania&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiHruSD4LPKAhXCDSwKHUkrA9gQ6AEIKjAE#v=onepage&q=tring&f=false|title=Multidisciplinary Academic research 2013|first=Collective of|last=authors|date=2 December 2013|publisher=MAC Prague consulting|via=Google Books}}</ref>
'''2010''' *In August 2010 Tring TV started broadcasting Sports Channels *Also in August Tring Communications taps Alcatel-Lucent for satellite TV over DSL<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=9vSn9aehEqgC&pg=PA3&lpg=PA3&dq=tring%20%20+albania#v=onepage&q=tring%20albania&f=false|title=European Telecom Monthly Newsletter 08-10|publisher=Information Gatekeepers, Inc|language=en}}</ref> *On September, Tring Communications picks Juniper Networks as a subscriber management and security solution<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://seenews.com/news/albanias-tring-communications-picks-subscriber-management-sys-by-u-s-juniper-networks-202695|title=Albania's Tring Communications Picks Subscriber Management Sys by U.S. Juniper Networks|website=seenews.com|language=en|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref>
'''2011''' *Tring launches the second season of Dancing With the Stars Albania show<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=QFfna7cP9DMC&pg=PT464&lpg=PT464&dq=tring+digital#v=onepage&q=tring%20digital&f=false|title=Justin Bieber|publisher=epubli|language=en}}</ref>
'''2012''' *In October Eutelsat’s Skylogic affiliate teams up with Tring Communications, to equip schools and post offices with the Tooway broadband service powered by the KA-SAT satellite.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.eutelsat.com/news/compress/en/2012/html/PR%206112%20Tring-Albania/PR%206112%20Tring-Albania.html|title=Eutelsat Satellite Broadband selected for free public internet access in Albania|website=www.eutelsat.com|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref>
'''2013''' *Tring upgraded the transmission format of its content from [[MPEG-2|MPEG 2]] to [[MPEG-4|MPEG 4]] on the terrestrial platform.
'''2014''' *Tring upgraded the transmission format of its contents from [[MPEG-2|MPEG 2]] to [[MPEG-4|MPEG 4]] on the satellite platform.<ref>[https://www.itu.int/en/ITU-D/Regional-Presence/Europe/Documents/Albania%20Digitalization%20Presentation.pdf Tring Coverage]</ref> *Tring launches My Tring IPTV, an [[IPTV]] system which deliveres the Tring TV television contents using the Internet protocol suite over a packet-switched network such as a [[Local area network|LAN]] or the Internet, instead of being delivered through traditional terrestrial, satellite signal, or cable television formats.
'''2016''' *Tring TV upgraded its playout infrastructure to a combination of PlayBox Technology Neo servers and CloudAir online services<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://playboxtechnology.com/news-and-events/case-studies/playbox-technology-twins-cloudair-and-airbox-neo-for-tring-tv-albania|title=PlayBox Technology Twins CloudAir and AirBox Neo for Tring TV, Albania {{!}} Case Studies {{!}} PlayBox Technology|website=playboxtechnology.com|language=en|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.tvtechnology.com/news/0002/albanias-tring-tv-installs-playbox-cloudair-and-airbox-neo/279887|title=Albania’s Tring TV Installs PlayBox CloudAir and AirBox Neo|last=TvTechnology|work=TV Technology|access-date=2018-02-27|language=en-US}}</ref> *on April Tring secures the rights to transmit Dinosaur Train, Doozers and Sid the Science Kid from [[The Jim Henson Company|Jim Henson Company]]<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.animationmagazine.net/tv/jim-henson-co-secures-multiple-global-preschool-deals/|title=Jim Henson Co. Secures Multiple Global Preschool Deals|date=2016-04-20|work=Animation Magazine|access-date=2018-02-27|language=en-US}}</ref> *on September Tring begins transmitting the "Dashuri me qira" TV series (Turk. "Kiralik Ask" , eng. "Love for Rent")<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.todotvnews.com/news/Global-Agency-nuevas-ventas-para-drama-Love-For-Rent.html|title=Global Agency anuncia nuevas ventas para su drama, Love For Rent|last=@todotvnews|website=Todotvnews|language=en|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref> '''2017''' *Tring secures the rights to transmit Jetë (Turkish: Hayat)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.c21media.net/turkeys-hayat-travels/|title=Turkish dramedy Hayat travels|website=C21media|language=en-us|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.todotvnews.com/news/Hayat-estara-al-aire-en-cuatro-territorios-nuevos.html|title=Hayat estará al aire en cuatro territorios nuevos|last=@todotvnews|website=Todotvnews|language=en|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref> *On July Tring begins transmitting the "Nusja nga Stambolli" TV series (Turk. "Istanbullu Gelin" , eng. "Evermore")<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.c21media.net/tring-mega-fall-for-evermore/|title=Tring, Mega fall for Evermore|website=C21media|language=en-us|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.todotvnews.com/news/Global-Agency-cierra-nuevas-ventas-para-Evermore.html|title=Global Agency cierra nuevas ventas para Evermore|last=@todotvnews|website=Todotvnews|language=en|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref> *On September Tring began the process of transition to digital broadcasting<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.broadbandtvnews.com/2016/01/07/albanian-digital-tv-concerns-mount/|title=Albanian digital TV concerns mount|date=2016-01-07|work=Broadband TV News|access-date=2018-02-27|language=en-GB}}</ref>
==Channels Categories== Tring original channels are: {| class="wikitable" ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Cinema ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Serials ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Kids ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Documentaries ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Lifestyle ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Generalist ! style="font-weight: bold;" | News ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Sport ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Music ! style="font-weight: bold;" | Adult |- | Tring Super | 3 Plus | Tring Tring | Tring History | Muse | Jolly HD<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://mavise.obs.coe.int/channel?id=13522|title=TV Channel: Tring Jolly HD|last=Observatory|first=European Audiovisual|website=mavise.obs.coe.int|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref> | Kanali 7 | Tring Sport 1 | Click TV | Bunga Bunga |- | Tring Comedy | Smile | Tip TV | Tring World | | | Tring Sport News | Tring Sport 2 | | Desire |- | Tring MAX | | Sofia | Tring Planet | | | | Tring Sport 3 | | Bizarre |- | Tring Fantasy | | | | | | | Tring Sport 4 | | |- | Tring Life | | | | | | | | | |- | Tring Shqip | | | | | | | | | |}
==Sports Events== {| cellpadding=5 style="border:1px solid #AA6633" class="wikitable" |- ! Championship !! Season !Championship !Season |- style="font-size:80%" | '''[[UEFA Champions League]]''' || 2015 - 2016 Season<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2269630.html#/|title=Where to watch the 2015/16 Champions League final|last=UEFA.com|work=UEFA.com|access-date=2018-02-27|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2398198.html#/|title=Where to watch the UEFA Champions League|last=UEFA.com|work=UEFA.com|access-date=2018-03-08|language=en}}</ref>
2016 - 2017Season<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://it.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2456857.html#/|title=Dove guardare la Champions League questa settimana|last=UEFA.com|work=UEFA.com|access-date=2018-02-27|language=it}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.sofascore.com/news/where-to-watch-juventus-vs-real-madrid-list-of-tv-channels-by-countries/|title=Where to watch Juventus vs Real Madrid – list of TV Channels by countries! - SofaScore News|date=2017-06-02|work=SofaScore News|access-date=2018-02-27|language=en-US}}</ref>
2017 - 2018 Season<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://it.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2402037.html#/|title=Dove guardare la UEFA Champions League|last=UEFA.com|work=UEFA.com|access-date=2018-02-27|language=it}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.uefa.com/uefasupercup/news/newsid=2476210.html#/|title=Where to watch the UEFA Super Cup|last=UEFA.com|website=UEFA.com|language=en|access-date=2018-02-27}}</ref> |[[Copa del Rey]] |2018<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.sport.es/es/noticias/real-madrid/horario-donde-ver-leganes-real-madrid-copa-2017-2018-6554440|title=Horario y dónde ver el Leganés - Real Madrid de Copa 2017 - 2018|last=Sport|date=2018-01-15|work=sport|access-date=2018-02-27|language=es}}</ref> |}
